messages.subject: RE: [samuraihistory] Iga warriors
messages.msgSnippet: No offence taken at all Mt Travis. ... _________________________________________________________________ Find a way to cure that travel bug MSN NZ Travel
messages.messageBody:
No offence taken at all Mt Travis.

> To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
> From: mrtravisgood@...
> Date: Sat, 16 May 2009 04:19:36 +0000
> Subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Iga warriors
>
> You are very, very right Matthew. I am sorry for noy thinking ahead on that one. I hope that we can become friends (and judging be your response that is likely). Thank you and take care. I look foreward to reading more about what you say.
>
> Travis
> Sent via BlackBerry from T-Mobile
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Matthew Anderson <thediusx@...>
>
> Date: Sat, 16 May 2009 03:47:03
> To: <samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com>
> Subject: RE: [samuraihistory] Iga warriors
>
>
>
> >break<Travis,If that's the worst response elicited from the forum, he's in pretty good shape.While none (or few, myself not included) of us know everything about samurai history, most seem to do a fair bit of research on our own before posting easily-answerable questions. Anybody posting clearly has an internet connection and it is a valuable and often first-step in the research process. A step that would have answered the question itself.Now, in spite of that rant, my intention was never actually to insult mc curio, but rather my initial response to AJ's answer because I initially spaced out what curio could possibly be referring to and AJ made me laugh.
> Wasn't aware I (nor anyone else for that matter) was expected to censor my response for fear of hurting someone's feelings (don't worry, you didn't hurt mine, I'm just explaining my intentions), and if I did I formally apologize to curio, though that bad karma is likely countered by the silly feelings possibly transferred to AJ and a few others.And I actually mainly became interested in the material via much more erudite relatives of the media you mentioned. Specifically: anime and comics (in the opposite order). SO :P
> To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
> From: mrtravisgood@...
> Date: Fri, 15 May 2009 03:33:49 +0000
> Subject: [samuraihistory] Iga warriors
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Hey Matthew Anderson. Mc_curio was just asking a question, he did not know. That is what this forum is all about. Everybody here did not know all there was about samurai history. You got interested in by watching a movie (like he did) or by reading a book. Give him a break.
>
>
>
> Travis Good
>
> Sent via BlackBerry from T-Mobile

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Iga warriors
messages.msgSnippet: You are very, very right Matthew. I am sorry for noy thinking ahead on that one. I hope that we can become friends (and judging be your response that is
messages.messageBody:
You are very, very right Matthew. I am sorry for noy thinking ahead on that one. I hope that we can become friends (and judging be your response that is likely). Thank you and take care. I look foreward to reading more about what you say.

Travis
Sent via BlackBerry from T-Mobile

-----Original Message-----
From: Matthew Anderson <thediusx@...>

Date: Sat, 16 May 2009 03:47:03
To: <samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com>
Subject: RE: [samuraihistory] Iga warriors



>break<Travis,If that's the worst response elicited from the forum, he's in pretty good shape.While none (or few, myself not included) of us know everything about samurai history, most seem to do a fair bit of research on our own before posting easily-answerable questions. Anybody posting clearly has an internet connection and it is a valuable and often first-step in the research process. A step that would have answered the question itself.Now, in spite of that rant, my intention was never actually to insult mc curio, but rather my initial response to AJ's answer because I initially spaced out what curio could possibly be referring to and AJ made me laugh.
Wasn't aware I (nor anyone else for that matter) was expected to censor my response for fear of hurting someone's feelings (don't worry, you didn't hurt mine, I'm just explaining my intentions), and if I did I formally apologize to curio, though that bad karma is likely countered by the silly feelings possibly transferred to AJ and a few others.And I actually mainly became interested in the material via much more erudite relatives of the media you mentioned. Specifically: anime and comics (in the opposite order). SO :P
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
From: mrtravisgood@...
Date: Fri, 15 May 2009 03:33:49 +0000
Subject: [samuraihistory] Iga warriors


























Hey Matthew Anderson. Mc_curio was just asking a question, he did not know. That is what this forum is all about. Everybody here did not know all there was about samurai history. You got interested in by watching a movie (like he did) or by reading a book. Give him a break.



Travis Good

Sent via BlackBerry from T-Mobile

messages.messageBody:
>break<Travis,If that's the worst response elicited from the forum, he's in pretty good shape.While none (or few, myself not included) of us know everything about samurai history, most seem to do a fair bit of research on our own before posting easily-answerable questions. Anybody posting clearly has an internet connection and it is a valuable and often first-step in the research process. A step that would have answered the question itself.Now, in spite of that rant, my intention was never actually to insult mc curio, but rather my initial response to AJ's answer because I initially spaced out what curio could possibly be referring to and AJ made me laugh.
Wasn't aware I (nor anyone else for that matter) was expected to censor my response for fear of hurting someone's feelings (don't worry, you didn't hurt mine, I'm just explaining my intentions), and if I did I formally apologize to curio, though that bad karma is likely countered by the silly feelings possibly transferred to AJ and a few others.And I actually mainly became interested in the material via much more erudite relatives of the media you mentioned. Specifically: anime and comics (in the opposite order). SO :P
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
From: mrtravisgood@...
Date: Fri, 15 May 2009 03:33:49 +0000
Subject: [samuraihistory] Iga warriors


























Hey Matthew Anderson. Mc_curio was just asking a question, he did not know. That is what this forum is all about. Everybody here did not know all there was about samurai history. You got interested in by watching a movie (like he did) or by reading a book. Give him a break.



Travis Good

Sent via BlackBerry from T-Mobile

messages.subject: Iga warriors
messages.msgSnippet: Hey Matthew Anderson. Mc_curio was just asking a question, he did not know. That is what this forum is all about. Everybody here did not know all there was
messages.messageBody:
Hey Matthew Anderson. Mc_curio was just asking a question, he did not know. That is what this forum is all about. Everybody here did not know all there was about samurai history. You got interested in by watching a movie (like he did) or by reading a book. Give him a break.

Travis Good
Sent via BlackBerry from T-Mobile
